snippet: Detectives and bank officials were operating under the assumption that whoever had put the counterfeit bills in the A.T.M.’s had done so to replace cash that was stolen.
abstract: New York City detectives discover counterfeit bills in ATMs at two Chase branches in Midtown Manhattan; teller machines at both banks were short some $110,000 and officials are operating under assumption that the counterfeit bills were intended to cover up a theft; police are looking into whether an employee at NCR Corporation, company that services the ATM machines, is a suspect.

byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

lead_paragraph: Detectives and bank officials were operating under the assumption that whoever had put the counterfeit bills in the A.T.M.’s had done so to replace cash that was stolen.

headline.seo: Counterfeit Bills Found at 2 Midtown Chase Banks
headline.main: Stacks of Counterfeit Bills Found in Teller Machines at 2 Midtown Banks
headline.print_headline: Stacks of Counterfeit Bills Found in Teller Machines at 2 Midtown Banks
